protocol_name: MALDI-TOF MS preparation for identification of mosquitoes

guidelines:
There are 3 main steps involved with preparing and launching a mosquito sample for MALDI-TOF analysis:

  • Preparing the matrix

The matrix solution ionises the proteins in the sample and is applied to the plate after the sample. The matrix must be very acidic.

  • Dissecting and crushing the sample
  • Preparing and launching the plate
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9ti","text":"Using a small spatula, put approx.   in the Eppendorf tube and return the stock powder to the fridge immediately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":35,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"89kc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"8DDF4130E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"50","unit":1,"label":"matrix powder (\u03b1-cyano-4-hydroxycinnamic acid)","step_guid":"B6D6F888F34841C1B73CD211637F8FC2"}}],"guid":"B6D6F888F34841C1B73CD211637F8FC2","id":683386,"previous_id":683385,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Preparing the matrix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qcsp","text":"Add  ,   and   to the Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":7,"length":1,"key":1},{"offset":13,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"c7oj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i8hb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cs2j3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"98031470E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"500","unit":1,"label":"100% ACN (acetonitrile)","step_guid":"960AF9A8E1D9494091B56115A97B80AA"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"A6009F70E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"475","unit":1,"label":"HPLC grade water","step_guid":"960AF9A8E1D9494091B56115A97B80AA"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"ACA0F140E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"25","unit":1,"label":"100% trifluoroacetic acid","step_guid":"960AF9A8E1D9494091B56115A97B80AA"}}],"guid":"960AF9A8E1D9494091B56115A97B80AA","id":683387,"previous_id":683386,"previous_guid":"B6D6F888F34841C1B73CD211637F8FC2","section":"Preparing the matrix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hef8","text":"Put Eppendorf tube with solution in\u00a0an ultrasonic bath\u00a0for   to homogenise the solution (yellow matrix powder will still be visible); then centrifuge the solution for   at 13 000 rpm\/ 20 784 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":59,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":167,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c1p6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4b4ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"B6F8CCD0E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":600,"label":"","step_guid":"EB1D9626B9564C46803EB1EB68AC5AE4"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"BB2CB280E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":600,"label":"","step_guid":"EB1D9626B9564C46803EB1EB68AC5AE4"}}],"guid":"EB1D9626B9564C46803EB1EB68AC5AE4","id":683388,"previous_id":683387,"previous_guid":"960AF9A8E1D9494091B56115A97B80AA","section":"Preparing the matrix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42qr0","text":"Retrieve the supernatant using a pipette, taking care to avoid taking up any powder. Discard the powder. The matrix can be kept at   in the dark for up to 2-3 days when creating high quality spectra for reference database. It can be kept for up to a week when using it for simple identification when high quality spectra are not vital.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":131,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c9j30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"C470FB30E93411E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","temperature":"4","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"7F05DD4D68F7484F864D720221AABD1D"}}],"guid":"7F05DD4D68F7484F864D720221AABD1D","id":683389,"previous_id":683388,"previous_guid":"EB1D9626B9564C46803EB1EB68AC5AE4","section":"Preparing the matrix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17rc0","text":"If using live mosquitoes, put the mosquitoes in the freezer ( ) for at least   prior to dissection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":61,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":77,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1ht74","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"avng6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"27EEF3B0E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","temperature":"-20","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"C859CB54FF7C4F1381318CCFBB62E26E"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"2B380430E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":60,"label":"","step_guid":"C859CB54FF7C4F1381318CCFBB62E26E"}}],"guid":"C859CB54FF7C4F1381318CCFBB62E26E","id":683391,"previous_id":683390,"previous_guid":"7F05DD4D68F7484F864D720221AABD1D","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cl1u1","text":"Using two sets of forceps, carefully remove the legs from the mosquito, using one pair to steady the specimen and the other to remove the legs. Place the legs in a labelled and sterile Eppendorf tube. The legs will stick to the sides of the tube due to static so try to put the legs at the bottom of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C58402316CE444A0B7FB796B90CB17F5","id":683392,"previous_id":683391,"previous_guid":"C859CB54FF7C4F1381318CCFBB62E26E","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6t30t","text":"If more than one species are being processed, decontaminate the forceps with 70% ethanol between species.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E1EEB4434BC143EFB106E8E600B7D955","id":683393,"previous_id":683392,"previous_guid":"C58402316CE444A0B7FB796B90CB17F5","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fp6e3","text":"Spin down the legs for   at 13 000 rpm\/  20 784 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":23,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"6e0fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"3D256700E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":60,"label":"","step_guid":"7F01D935B678415483C839B4564E5893"}}],"guid":"7F01D935B678415483C839B4564E5893","id":683394,"previous_id":683393,"previous_guid":"E1EEB4434BC143EFB106E8E600B7D955","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tjp0","text":"Add   and   to each tube then add glass beads (<106um, acid washed). Estimate the volume, making the amount of glass\u00a0beads just less than half of the volume of liquid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":10,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"tl03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2kg2h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"445E7660E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"15","unit":1,"label":"50% CAN","step_guid":"53180B30FABF4A9EBAD5B30CE2710993"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"4AB737E0E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"15","unit":1,"label":"70% formic acid","step_guid":"53180B30FABF4A9EBAD5B30CE2710993"}}],"guid":"53180B30FABF4A9EBAD5B30CE2710993","id":683395,"previous_id":683394,"previous_guid":"7F01D935B678415483C839B4564E5893","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a928p","text":"Place tubes in the TissueLyser II (Qiagen) canisters, making sure each side is balanced. NB: Both the tubes and the canisters need to be balanced. Make sure the top and bottom lids correlate and that the heavy sides are both either facing inward or both outward.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7361FD2741F145DC8C2DE4EB07946D9D","id":683396,"previous_id":683395,"previous_guid":"53180B30FABF4A9EBAD5B30CE2710993","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5iv7b","text":"Crush the legs using a cycle of 3 x  at 30 Hz, letting the sample rest for approx.   between each minute. NB: the legs will not be fully crushed in the tube; too much protein will inhibit the reaction as in PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":36,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":83,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9hb98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ae85k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"56C30500E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":60,"label":"","step_guid":"0652A0AB442D4EA0A869963EE0E2F29C"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"5B952680E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","duration":15,"label":"","step_guid":"0652A0AB442D4EA0A869963EE0E2F29C"}}],"guid":"0652A0AB442D4EA0A869963EE0E2F29C","id":683397,"previous_id":683396,"previous_guid":"7361FD2741F145DC8C2DE4EB07946D9D","section":"Preparing the sample"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7qn9u","text":"Load   on the plate in quadruplicate keeping within the spots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":5,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"15jp0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"750E2580E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"1","unit":1,"label":"of each sample","step_guid":"39BBFBF6934B4333870A5F357B9C8CA3"}}],"guid":"39BBFBF6934B4333870A5F357B9C8CA3","id":683399,"previous_id":683398,"previous_guid":"0652A0AB442D4EA0A869963EE0E2F29C","section":"Preparing the plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed23g","text":"Allow the sample to evaporate then load   over the sample, allow to dry completely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"de5tf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"81E8DB60E93511E8BFC3E7B2BF92A082","amount":"1","unit":1,"label":"matrix solution","step_guid":"8E625D70FD8D4A929514A42B3DC83635"}}],"guid":"8E625D70FD8D4A929514A42B3DC83635","id":683400,"previous_id":683399,"previous_guid":"39BBFBF6934B4333870A5F357B9C8CA3","section":"Preparing the plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t3j4","text":"Place the plate in a cool, dark (photosensitive matrix) place until it\u2019s time to launch it. NB: the prepared plates can be left for max. 2-3 days in a dark place at room temperature before affecting the spectra. If using for simple identification \u2013 it can be kept for a longer period.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BEAEA0FF44624738A325C578A7E65240","id":683401,"previous_id":683400,"previous_guid":"8E625D70FD8D4A929514A42B3DC83635","section":"Preparing the plate"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuqmm","text":"Plate is ready to be launched in MALDI-TOF MS machine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F943090A3CFA490C966C5A5A26A545F3","id":683402,"previous_id":683401,"previous_guid":"BEAEA0FF44624738A325C578A7E65240","section":"Preparing the plate"}
